trans-unit.source: Represents the abstract base class from which all <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Transform>" name="<Transform>" href=""></xref> elements that can be used in an XML digital signature derive.
When performing XML signing and verification, the <`Transform`> element describes how the signer transformed the data object that was signed.
The verifier of a document then uses the <`Transform`> element to transform the signed data in the same manner.
If the verifier cannot transform the signed data in the same manner, the document cannot be verified.
Use a class that derives from the Transform class whenever you need to add one or more transform objects to an encrypted XML document or to a signed XML document.

For more information about the `<Transform>` element, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available from the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/, or the XML encryption specification, which is available from the W3C at www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies the algorithm performed by the current transform.
This property corresponds to the Algorithm attribute of a `<Transform>` element in an XMLDSIG signature.
For example, the algorithm URI for the Base64 decoding transform is defined as http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#base64 in the XMLDSIG specification (Section 6.6.2).
You can conveniently set this value using one of the static fields associated with the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> class.
The URI that identifies the algorithm performed by the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.

Gets or sets an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that represents the document context under which the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object is running.
When signing a document, the Context property represents the value passed to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.SignedXml> constructor.
When verifying a document, the Context property represents <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Signature> object.
The Context property is set automatically during signature computation and checking, but before transforms are invoked.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that represents the document context under which the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object is running.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the digest associated with a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithm"></xref> object used to create a digest.
The digest associated with a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.

When overridden in a derived class, returns an XML representation of the parameters of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object that are suitable to be included as subelements of an XMLDSIG <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Transform>" name="<Transform>" href=""></xref> element.

A list of the XML nodes that represent the transform-specific content needed to describe the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object in an XMLDSIG <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Transform>" name="<Transform>" href=""></xref> element.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object of the specified type.
The GetOutput method returns the output of the current transform after it is run on the value previously set by a call to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.LoadInput%2A> method.
The type of the returned object must be one of the type objects in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.OutputTypes%2A> property.
The type of the output to return.
This must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.OutputTypes*> property.
The output of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object as an object of the specified type.
Returns the XML representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> object returned by this method conforms to the XML Scheme for the `<Transform>` element defined in Section 4.3.3.4 of the XMLDSIG specification.
The XML representation of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.

When overridden in a derived class, gets an array of types that are valid inputs to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.LoadInput*> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The array returned by the InputTypes property must contain at least one element because every <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object must accept at least one type as valid input.

A <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform> object typically accepts one or more of the following types as input: <xref:System.IO.Stream>, <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument>, or <xref:System.Xml.XmlNodeList>.

An array of valid input types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object; you can pass only objects of one of these types to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.LoadInput*> method of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.

When overridden in a derived class, parses the specified <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object as transform-specific content of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Transform>" name="<Transform>" href=""></xref> element and configures the internal state of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object to match the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<Transform>" name="<Transform>" href=""></xref> element.
This method is used to process subelements of a `<Transform>` element.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlNodeList"></xref> object that specifies transform-specific content for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
When overridden in a derived class, loads the specified input into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The type of the input object must be one of the types in the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.InputTypes%2A> property.
The input to load into the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.

When overridden in a derived class, gets an array of types that are possible outputs from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.GetOutput*> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
The array returned by the OutputTypes property must contain at least one element because every transform must generate at least one type as output.

An array of valid output types for the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object; only objects of one of these types are returned from the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform.GetOutput*> methods of the current <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> object that contains the namespaces that are propagated into the signature.
XML namespaces are used to distinguish different elements in a document that have the same name.

The <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> keys of the PropagatedNamespaces property are the namespace prefixes and the <xref:System.Collections.Hashtable> values are the namespace Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs).
The PropagatedNamespaces property is set automatically during signature computation and checking, but before transforms are invoked.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Hashtable"></xref> object that contains the namespaces that are propagated into the signature.
The PropagatedNamespaces property was set to <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Sets the current <xref href="System.Xml.XmlResolver"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> class resolves external XML resources named by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
If you do not trust the source of the XML file, you might not want to allow the XML file to access computer resources named by the URI.
The Resolver property allows you to control the level of access that XML files have to computer resources by specifying different <xref:System.Xml.XmlResolver> objects.
If you do not want to allow any access, you can set this property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The current <xref href="System.Xml.XmlResolver"></xref> object.
This property defaults to an <xref href="System.Xml.XmlSecureResolver"></xref> object.
